reviewText: Yes, Tiki Man is cheap. And yes, it can be addictive for a couple of minutes.\n\nThen I realized that it just made me want to play One Finger Death Punch again. reviewText:
This game is both brutally frustrating yet addictively fun!

Why is this not popular? This is like Flappy Bird, only with a Tiki-Man with a wood problem.

This game is cheap as hell too. You could spend hours and hours of fun and frustratingly trying to pull your hair out just to beat your highscore or go even higher. This game is simply addicting. Once you get used to the controls and the overall rhythm of the chopping and when to avoid the wooden chainsaw of death, you can pretty much hit high score. It's all about having extremely high amounts of patience, concentration and tolerance to that awful, repetive music.

PROS:

- Addictive
- Fun
- Frustrating
- Cute graphics.
- Simple gameplay.
- Smooth gameplay.
- Nice backgrounds.
- Cheap game. You get your money's worth. Three times.

CONS:

- The night background sometimes camouflages the wooden chainsaws, which can be very hard to see or avoid unless you concentrate real hard and look.
- No other music other than the template music. (You can mute your sound and play something else though.)
- Will frustrate the hell out of you, just like what Flappy Bird did to me.
- Will make you kill your dog.
- Might make you punch your computer out of frustration.
- No multiplayer.
- No leaderboards.
- That freaking soundtrack.


810

reviewText:
Considering I have only purchased this game recently, it is very easy to grasp and v-e-r-y adicting. In this game your player must slash the levels of what must be the world's largest Tiki. You simply press left and right arrow keys or click to the sides with your mouse to avoid the jagged sides of certain levels. Simple and very fun, especially with differing backgrounds and characters.

Pros-

-Different backgrounds
-Different characters
-Competitivity
-Well worth the price

Cons-
-Leaderboards would be nice

reviewText:
Ever fancied chopping down the world’s tallest tiki? If the answer is yes then Tiki Man may be the game for you.

Gameplay
Oddly additive. It’s one of the simplest games you’ll ever play and that’s part of the reason it’s so playable. The basic aim of the game is to chop the tiki faces and avoid the tiki arms, it may sound easy but it sure isn’t. The game challenges you to play at pace and keep that pace going as the sections become more difficult.

Unlocks
With four luscious tropical environments and sixteen Tiki Men to unlock there’s certainly a lot for you to earn but you’ll have to be a master of pace to get them all.

Style
It feels very much like one of those Flash Games you’d play at school when you thought no one was watching or when you’ve got a space couple of minutes. It’s by no means the most beautiful game but the look fits perfectly with the style of play, it doesn’t need to be anything more complex because it’s reflective of the simple, quick style you play.

Compete with friends
There’s no multiplayer game modes or challenge your friends modes but that doesn’t mean to say you can’t compete with them. This game has a super simple leaderboard similar to Flappy Birds in which it sounds you your Best Score and your last score. So it’s time to get chopping and beating your friends high scores.

Published Blog Post[www.dabs.com]
